revised_title: The Role of Mechanical Tension in the Structure of Vertebrate Smooth Muscle
tldr: The authors conducted a study on the longitudinal layer of the guinea-pig ileum, a type of vertebrate smooth muscle, to understand the role of mechanical tension in the structure of these muscles. They discovered that thick filaments, consisting of myosin, are regular constituents of smooth muscle, and their preservation requires mechanical tension. The sliding filament model is valid for both smooth and striated muscles, suggesting that smooth muscles also consist of contractile units randomly distributed along the cell axis.
